question_text: Which of the following is most important when aligning wires into the RJ45 connector before crimping?
answer_options: Using a shielded connector for all installations
Matching the wire colors with the EIA/TIA wiring standard
Cutting the wires unevenly for flexibility
correct_answer: Matching the wire colors with the EIA/TIA wiring standard
explanation: Correctly aligning the wires using the appropriate EIA/TIA standard (such as T568A or T568B) ensures consistent pinouts and proper connectivity.
